verses.verse: By the rivers<WH5104> of Babylon,<WH894> there we sat down.<WH3427> Yes,<WH1058> we wept, when we remembered<WH2142> Zion.<WH6726>
On the willows<WH6155> in its midst,<WH8432> we hung<WH8518> up our harps.<WH3658>

For there,<WH7617> those who led us captive asked<WH7592> us for songs.<WH1697> Those who tormented<WH8437> us demanded songs<WH1697> of joy:<WH7891> "Sing us one of the songs<WH7892> of Zion!<WH6726>"
How can we sing<WH7891> Yahweh<WH3068>'s song<WH7892> in a foreign<WH5236> land?<WH127>
If I forget<WH7911> you,<WH3389> Jerusalem, let my right hand<WH3225> forget its skill.<WH7911>
Let my tongue<WH3956> stick<WH1692> to the roof of my mouth<WH2441> if I don't<WH2142> remember you;<WH5927> if I don't prefer Jerusalem<WH3389> above my chief<WH7218> joy.<WH8057>

Remember,<WH2142> Yahweh,<WH3068> against the children<WH1121> of Edom,<WH123> the day<WH3117> of Jerusalem;<WH3389> who said,<WH559> "Raze<WH6168> it!<WH6168> Raze it even to its foundation!<WH3247>"
Daughter<WH1323> of Babylon,<WH894> doomed to destruction,<WH7703> he will be happy<WH835> who rewards<WH7999> you,<WH1580> as you have served us.
Happy<WH835> shall he be,<WH270> who takes and dashes<WH5310> your little ones<WH5768> against the rock.<WH5553>
